intro: Eunomia cephalantha, commonly known as the head flower, is a unique member of the Apocynaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, helmet-shaped flowers that are typically bright orange or yellow. The plant has a succulent stem and fleshy leaves, adapted to arid environments. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
